tool.name: CCTop
tool.command:
which python; bowtie_bin=`which bowtie`; bowtie_dir=`dirname \$bowtie_bin`; #if $input_files.genome_source != 'built-in': mkdir index; bowtie-build -r -f $input_files.ownFile index/bowtie; #end if
$__tool_directory__/CCTop.py --bowtie "\$bowtie_dir" #if $input_files.genome_source == 'built-in': --index $input_files.genome.fields.path #else: --index index/bowtie #end if --pam $pam_type.value --input $input_sequences --targetSize $target_size.value --totalMM $totalMM #if $genesFile and $exonsFile: --genesFile $genesFile --exonsFile $exonsFile #end if

param.name: genome_source
param.label: Select genome source
param.option: Use a genome from your history

param.name: genome
param.label: Select a genome build
param.help: If the genome build of your interest is not listed contact your Galaxy admin

param.name: input_sequences
param.label: Fasta file containing the sequence(s) to be scanned for sgRNA candidates

param.name: totalMM
param.label: Number of total maximum mismatches allowed in the off-target sites

param.name: coreLength
param.label: Number of bases that enclose the core of the target site

param.name: maxOT
param.label: Maximum number of off-target sites to be reported (Reports all if this value is not set)

param.name: exonsFile
param.label: Pseudo-bed file containing the coordinate of exons in the target genome

param.name: genesFile
param.label: Pseudo-bed file containing the coordinate of genes in the target genome

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does** CCTop is a tool to determine suitable CRISPR/Cas9 target sites in a given query sequence(s) and predict its potential off-target sites.
